column1: so how are you doing today good
like surfing that I used to lecture from that I do construction that did construction I just like the people that the weather

not really I usually stay in this area
hi like I went to Las Vegas and went out to see the fire Canyon that was nice
walking down the trails and fire Canyon and experiencing all the formations and things that were there
all I was in construction but now I'm retired and disabled
do you consider yourself more shy or outgoing I'm kind of shy and reserved at first but then once I get to know people then I'm pretty outgoing and everything
why am I shy or why am I outgoing
I was raised in foster care so I don't have much familiarity with my family but with foster parents
sometimes when I'm feeling 10 I turn on the fish tank screensaver
I know it's not Hawaii but it's the best I've got
go downstairs smoke a cigarette with friends talk with friends
hahaha it's been too long to remember I die I'm a very happy person get along go lucky person with anybody in it so it's hard to get me riled
guilty guilty and I couldn't tell you I don't feel guilty about anything to feel guilty about
tell me about the hardest decision you've ever had to make
tell me about Nevada or something that you wish you could erase from
how my dad was in the military my grandfather was in the military and you know it's a family tradition
are you happy you did that was good
I just crawled underneath planes and hook them up their catapults and shot him off the flight deck
how it was it was easy no problem
it just made me more responsible I guess
how have you been feeling lately good
shoulder pain back pain knee pain
not like I said I'm a happy-go-lucky person you know on
takes a lot to get me riled
no problem I turn off the TV I go to sleep
wake up in the morning refreshed feeling fine
because it's a good thing to feel fine
can you tell me about that
last time I felt really happy I was at the wedding for my for my niece I was a good time
the pastor and his wife I go to church every Sunday
can you tell me about that they helped raise me when I was younger in foster homes but then they've been in and out of my life ever since and they always help me out
when I get down I guess or whatever
went down walked around the beach hadn't seen the beach in a long time walked around the pier really enjoyed that

some of my sculpturing and a lot of the jobs I did their work work that I put into him and go by and show people that the jobs I did you can see it and I'm happy about the things I did
